message.body: I did some numbers on my end. I think with the car it about evens out. My apologies on being petty.
I didn't do the numbers because I felt no need to. I said I would if it would make you feel better and I would need your input as I may have holes in my info
Well it looks like I paid you $3300 in rent for 5 months.
And I put $857.00 into house expenses.
we can make it as complex as we want, but I felt that it would be an unnecessary inconvieniece
But you paid me back $1000.00
I believe we agreed on $500 a month for you to contribute to house expenses
yes
which I am not concerned with
the main thing was the checks you wrote me and the expenses for renovations
I put about $2900 into the car purchase not including insurance costs
RIght, I put $2600.
I hope you can see why I cashed the check back in june. I didnt feel like I was taking advantage. I dont think I have ever taken advantage in my life
I could get super petty and calculate money I put into groceries, but that's just stupid. I know you paid for electric and whatnot.
like I said, you can make it as complex as you want. This is why I dont bother to tally it up, it just gets messy and overcomplicated
I guess the bottom line was I never felt taken care of in the relationship. So yes, it's not about the money afterall.
Lets not even get into the parking tickets and towing fees

I never really had an opportunity to take care of you. You took care of yourself quite nicely. In many ways I would have preferred it if I was the one taking care of you more. It makes me feel better about myself, I suppose

That's not what I recall. I recall you holding a lot of stuff over my head when it came to you doing something special or paying for my dinner. Like our one year anniversary dinner. All I heard was complaints from you about going to dinner and paying for dinner. That's why I thought of when you sent me that text.
And I recall you yelling at me when I was doing something wrong and needed your help. I don't think tha's helpful at all.
I honestly don't recall that. I was being ridiculous about money back then, i don't know why. I was having a hard time because work was sucking and I had alot of bills
Well you took it out on me.
Ill admit, at times I unfairly took it out on you, but thats how it works. Its unfortunate, but its just how it goes. I realize that a lot of my frustration came from my own life
I only wish we could have dealt with those things as they happened instead of letting them build up. It was not the best way to handle it
One thing that I always thought was strange is that whenever we had a disagreement, I would end up making you see it my way, and you would apologize
Well that's becuase I was afraid of the outcome.
I never understood that. I mean it felt good to have my point taken, but I didnt feel you were trying hard enough to stand your ground
what was I going to do?
Perhaps listen to my feelings on things and see my perspective.
I know that I come off that way sometimes, but you have to remember that I am 5% serious when I am talking that way
I always listened, but I didnt always understand your perspective
bottom line, even thought it would not be easy, you cant let someone get away with it
and if you felt strongly about not being able to 'open up' or be understood, then professional help is what we needed, and I would have seen that eventually, even though I didnt at first
